akas: The Wiggles TV Series 7 Australia (first season title)
The Wiggles TV Series 8 Australia (second season title)
The Wiggles: Wake Up, Lachy! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Emma's Bowtiful Day! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Anthony's Fruity Feast! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Simon Says! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Fun, Fun, Fun! Australia (DVD title)
akas from release info: The Wiggles TV Series 7 Australia (first season title)
The Wiggles TV Series 8 Australia (second season title)
The Wiggles: Wake Up, Lachy! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Emma's Bowtiful Day! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Anthony's Fruity Feast! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Simon Says! Australia (DVD title)
The Wiggles: Fun, Fun, Fun! Australia (DVD title)

1.title: Captain's Lost Hornpipe
1.plot: It's National Hornpipe Day and Captain Feathersword is so excited to teach The Wiggles his famous hornpipe. Sadly, Captain's hornpipe is broken. The Wiggles call Hilary Hornpipe for help.

2.title: Emma's Ballet
2.plot: Emma dresses up as a ballerina for a Wiggly guessing game. Will The Wiggles guess what she is dressed up as or is it "tutu" hard? We do some "bow-tiful" ballet with 'Emma's Bow Minuet'.

3.title: Apples & Bananas
3.plot: Dorothy the Dinosaur has a chat to her friends and asks them all about pets and we get to play with some puppy dogs. We sing and dance along to 'Apples and Bananas', and even join The Wiggles live on stage to sing 'Hot Potato'.

4.title: Emma's Bike Won't Work
4.plot: Emma gets ready to ride her bike but it won't work. The Wiggles call Willy Fixit for some help. We say hello to 'Little Sir Echo' then it's time for some animal fun as we learn about a 'Talking Cow'.

5.title: Dressing Up in Style
5.plot: Emma teaches some "bow-tiful" ballet in her pointe shoes. We scat along with Lachy as we 'Do the Skeleton Scat!' then it's off to The Wiggles' show to dance along to 'Romp Bomp a Stomp' live in concert. It's "stomptastic".

6.title: Lachy Can't Rhyme
6.plot: Lachy is trying to write a rhyming poem with the word 'cat' but is having some trouble. He brings back William Shakespeare to help him. We learn all about the letter 'F' in 'Simon's Alphabet'.

7.title: Simon's Brush with Fame
7.plot: Simon dresses up as a painter for a wiggly guessing game. We can listen to the clues and help The Wiggles guess what Simon is dressed as. We learn about gloriously, great, guitars in 'Simon's Alphabet', then head to the zoo.

8.title: Big Red Boat
8.plot: Put your life jackets on and lets go sailing as we sing along to 'Big Red Boat'. Emma teaches us some Irish dancing then we all Irish dance together to 'I'll Tell Me Ma'. And Simon sings a duet with Zamel the Camel.

9.title: Anthony Forgets
9.plot: Anthony is in charge of doing the wiggly grocery shopping but he has become a bit forgetful. The Wiggles call Mary and Michael Memory for some help. We do some "bow-tifiul" ballet with Emma as she sings 'Fa la Ninna'.

10.title: Do the Hawk
10.plot: We sing and dance along to 'Do the Hawk' with Lee Hawkins. Dorothy the Dinosaur talks to her friends about painting and we do some arts and crafts together. We learn all about juicy, jiggly, jellyfish in 'Simon's Alphabet'.

11.title: Simon Can't Stop Yodelling
11.plot: Simon smells a special yodeling flower and can't stop yodeling. The Wiggles call Dr Heidi Von Trappington for help. The yodeling continues as we sing along to 'Simon's Cold Water Blues'.

12.title: Cowboy Anthony
12.plot: Anthony dresses up as a cowboy for a wiggly guessing game. We use the clues to help The Wiggles guess what Anthony is dressed up as. The western fun continues as we sing along to 'Cowboys and Cowgirls' live in the House.

13.title: Simon's Sad Fruit Salad
13.plot: Simon's singing is making him feel too sad to eat his fruit salad. The Wiggles call Jonathon Joy and Cindy Serenity to help Simon feel better. We sing and dance along to 'Shortnin' Bread' and do the actions to 'Simon Says'.

14.title: The Talking Cow
14.plot: It's down to the farm to sing and dance along with the 'Talking Cow'. Emma teaches a hip hop dance lesson and Simon teaches us about the letter 'N'.

15.title: Beaky Can't Sing
15.plot: Lachy tries to sing an Italian duet with his bird Beaky but Beaky can't sing. The Wiggles call Bertie Birdman for help. We jump along with 'Five Little Joeys' and dance the ballet to 'Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star'.

16.title: Little Sir Echo
16.plot: Dorothy the Dinosaur talks to her friends all about instruments and we watch a band playing their instruments. We say hello to 'Little Sir Echo' and Simon sings a duet with Zamel the Camel.

17.title: Ahoy There, Lachy
17.plot: Lachy is dressing up as a sailor for a wiggly guessing game. We use the clues to help The Wiggles guess what Lachy is dressed as. We all dress up in style and sing along to 'Dressing Up'.

18.title: Emma Can't Read
18.plot: Emma tries to read a book but can't see anything. The Wiggles call Dr Spectacle to help Emma see again. Then we all sing along to 'I've Got My Glasses On'. We can see clearly now.

19.title: This Little Piggy
19.plot: Emma teaches us some jazz dancing and we learn how to do a jazz turn. We dance some "bow-tiful" ballet in 'Emma's Bow Minuet' and sing along to 'This Little Piggy Went to Market' with special guest Lee Hawkins.

20.title: Beep! Beep! Buckle Up!
20.plot: Dorothy the Dinosaur talks to her friends about driving in the car and we learn about car safety as we sing along to 'Beep. Beep. Buckle Up!' Simon sings a duet with Zamel the Camel and we watch the wheels go round and round.

21.title: Anthony's Singing
21.plot: Anthony keeps singing too loudly. The Wiggles call volume control specialists Senator Soul and Lady Rock and Roll to help Anthony get his voice back to normal. We sing along and do the actions to 'Michael Finnegan'.

22.title: King Simon
22.plot: Simon dresses up as a king for a wiggly guessing game. We use the clues to help The Wiggles guess what Simon is dressed as. We learn all about a vivacious, vibrant violin in 'Simon's Alphabet'.

23.title: Wiggle Talk
23.plot: Simon is only speaking in Wiggle words. The Wiggles call Dr Rock for some help. We hear about a wild, wonderful wolf in 'Simon's Alphabet' and sing along to 'Have a Good Day (Kia Pai to Ra)'.

24.title: Wiggly Picnic
24.plot: We have a wiggly ballet lesson with Emma and dance the ballet to 'Fa la Ninna'. Dorothy the Dinosaur talks to her friends about going on a wiggly picnic and so then we have a picnic together.

25.title: Beaky Overeats
25.plot: The Wiggles have accidentally overfed their bird, Beaky. They call Dr Gallah for some help. We flap our wings and dance along to 'Feeling Chirpy' and then it's time for some alphabet fun with Professor Simon.

26.title: Zamel the Camel
26.plot: Get ready to sing along to 'Zamel the Camel' and count the humps on Zamel's back. We'll help The Wiggles wash a puppy dog as they sing 'Scrubby, Dub, Dub', and learn about the letter 'Z' with Professor Simon.

27.title: Wags Has Lost His Wiggle
27.plot: Anthony dresses up as a spider as we do the actions to 'Itsy Bitsy Spider'. We discover that Wags has lost his wiggle. The Wiggles call Dr Antonio, Maria and Lucia to help Wags. Will Wags get his Wiggle back?

28.title: Miss Lucy Had a Ducky
28.plot: Sing along with The Wiggles as they tell the story of 'Miss Lucy Had a Ducky'. We have a tap dancing lesson with Emma and learn how to do a shuffle. We learn about the letter 'B' with Professor Simon.

29.title: A Mariachi Moment
29.plot: Anthony has dressed up as a mariachi musician for a wiggly guessing game. I wonder if the other Wiggles will guess what Anthony is dressed as. We sing a spooky song about Mumbles the Monster and the dancing continues.

30.title: Riding in the Big Red Car
30.plot: Let's all buckle up and sing along as we go riding in the Big Red Car. There's more musical fun as we go 'Dancing on the High Seas' with Captain Feathersword then it's off to The Wiggles' show to dance.

31.title: The Laughing Doctor
31.plot: Simon has trouble singing the high notes so The Wiggles call Dr High-Low to help Simon out. We sing and dance along to 'The Full Moon Melody' and dance some beautiful ballet to 'Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star'.

32.title: Irish Dancing!
32.plot: It's time for a wiggly dance class with Emma. We learn how to do some Irish dancing. Dorothy has a chat to her friends all about safe swimming then it's off to the pools.

33.title: Emma the Firefighter
33.plot: Emma is dressing as a firefighter for a wiggly guessing game. Can The Wiggles guess what she is dressed as using the clues? We learn about glorious, great guitars in 'Simon's Alphabet' then it's time for a musical treat.

34.title: Lachy's Orange Hair!
34.plot: Lachy's hair turns orange so The Wiggles call Professor Perm for help. Can she return Lachy's hair to it's former glory? We learn about the letter 'H' with Professor Simon then it's time to get jumping as we sing and dance.

35.title: Romp Bomp a Stomp
35.plot: Simon sings an operatic duet with Zamel the Camel. Then it's time to relax as we sing 'Koala-By' with some sleeping koalas. We have some literacy fun with Professor Simon then it's time to watch The Wiggles perform.

36.title: What's Your Favourite Nursery Rhyme?
36.plot: We dance some beautiful ballet with Emma, Wags and the wiggly ballerinas. Simon asks us "what's your favorite nursery rhyme?" and we do all the actions to 'The Wheels on the Bus'.

37.title: Detective Lachy
37.plot: Lachy is dressing up for a wiggly guessing game. I wonder if The Wiggles can guess what he is dressed as by using the clues. We sail along the ocean blue in the 'Big Red Boat' then groove along to 'Hey, Wags.

38.title: Emma's Bad Hair Day
38.plot: The wind has blown Emma's hair everywhere. They call Dr Hairy and his sister Harriet to help fix Emma's hair problem. We learn all about the letter 'L' in 'Simon's Alphabet'.

39.title: Lachy Can't Sing
39.plot: Lachy has lost his voice. The Wiggles call Dr Phillipa Frog for help. Will Lachy get his voice back in time for The Wiggles' town concert? We dance some beautiful ballet with Emma as she sings 'Sur le Pont D' Avignon'.

40.title: Say the Dance, Do the Dance
40.plot: Emma teaches us how to do some ballet in a Wiggly dance lesson. It's so "bow-tiful". The dancing continues as we sing and dance along to 'Say the Dance, Do the Dance'. We practice our literacy with Professor Simon.

41.title: Emma's Missing Bow
41.plot: Emma has lost her bow. The Wiggles call bow detectives Lucia, Maria and Antonio, as well as Chief Inspector Hawk. Will they be able to find Emma's bow? Professor Simon teaches us about the letter 'O' then we sing and dance.

42.title: Captain's Magic Buttons
42.plot: Anthony is all dressed up for a wiggly guessing game. Will The Wiggles guess what Anthony is dressed as by using the clues? Things get spooky as we sing and dance along to 'Skeleton Scat'.

43.title: Simon the Opera Singer
43.plot: Simon is dressed up as an opera singer for a wiggly guessing game. I wonder if The Wiggles can guess what Simon is dressed up as. We learn about the letter 'Q' in 'Simon's Alphabet' and groove along to 'Pappadum'.

44.title: Dorothy's Baking
44.plot: Dorothy the Dinosaur chats to her friends all about their favourite foods then we bake a cake together in the kitchen. We watch the wheels go round and round in 'Jack's Wheelchair Song'.

45.title: Lachy's Bunny Caller
45.plot: Lachy has trouble calling a bunny and ends up with Mr Funny and Sunny. Will Lachy be able to find some bunnies? We bounce along to the 'Bunny Hop' and take a drive and sing along to 'In the Big Red Car We Like to Ride'.

46.title: Food, Trains and Animals!
46.plot: Dorothy the Dinosaur has a chat to her friends all about healthy food, and then we head to the kitchen to make a sandwich. We learn all about the letter 'T' in 'Simon's Alphabet' and sing 'Wobbly Camel' in The Wiggles' house.

47.title: Princess Emma of Wiggle House
47.plot: Emma dresses up as a princess for a wiggly guessing game. Will The Wiggles guess what Emma is dressed up as? We dance along to 'Emma's Bow Minuet', and learn about all the treasures Emma keeps in her room.

48.title: Anthony Has Overeaten!
48.plot: Anthony has eaten too much food and isn't feeling too good. The Wiggles call Phil Fitness to help Anthony out. Will Phil be able to help Anthony feel better?

49.title: Hip Hop with Emma
49.plot: We have a wiggly dance lesson with Emma and learn how to do some hip hop. We 'Do the Hawk' with special guest Lee Hawkins and do the actions to 'Pufferbillies'. We learn all about the letter 'W' in 'Simon's Alphabet'.

50.title: Lachy's Bird Poem
50.plot: Lachy is having trouble finding rhyming words for his poetry. Lachy calls Beaky the Galah to help him out. Will Lachy be able to finish his poem? We move our arms just like a birdy and dance along to 'Feeling Chirpy'.

51.title: I'll Tell Me Ma!
51.plot: Anthony dresses up in style for a wiggly guessing game. I wonder if The Wiggles will guess what Anthony is dressed up as. We do some Irish dancing to 'I'll Tell Me Ma' with Emma and the wiggly Irish dancers.

52.title: Lachy's Pappadum Party
52.plot: Lachy is having trouble with his most recent invention. Dr Good-Food comes to the rescue to help Lachy out. We do the actions to 'The Wheels on the Bus' and sing and dance along to 'Pappadum'.

1.title: Miss Polly Had a Dolly
1.plot: Emma's dolly has taken ill and so The Wiggles call for the doctor. Singing this story makes everyone feel so much better. Add some fun with 'Simon Says' and traveling in the Big Red Car and we're all ready, steady, wiggling.

2.title: Wake up, Lachy!
2.plot: Dance and follow the actions with 'Follow the Leader', then point your fingers, do the twist and call out 'Wake Up, Lachy'. Finally, join in with the beautiful singing of 'Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star'.

3.title: Lachy Shrunk the Wiggles
3.plot: Lachy's inventions always result in lots of fun and this time he's shrunk Emma and Anthony. Luckily, Lachy has a solution, with even funnier results. Join The Wiggles in the world's catchiest song.

4.title: The Wiggly Singing Symphony
4.plot: Simon demonstrates the difference between high and low notes to Dorothy while Emma signs the ABC for the hearing impaired. The Wiggles take to the beach to 'Say the Dance, Do the Dance.

5.title: Taba Naba
5.plot: The Wiggles sing 'Taba Naba', a song from the Torres Strait Islands all about having fun at the reef. Emma recites a piggy poem, and we all jump in the Big Red Car to travel through the mountains and the countryside.

6.title: Wash Your Hands
6.plot: The Wiggles have all been doing different activities and are about to eat, but what have they forgotten to do? It's time to wash their hands. Emma tells us that she can see clearer now that she wears her glasses.

7.title: Spring Has Come
7.plot: The Wiggles sing a song in Japanese about the coming of Spring. Emma wears a kimono while the other Wiggles wear 'happy coats' for the delightful 'Haru Ga Kita'.

8.title: Simon Goes Quackers!
8.plot: Lachy's inventions always result in fun. This time he makes a drink that turns Simon into a duck. We meet Mumbles the monster, have fun with Anthony's Alphabet and yodel with 'Simon's Cold Water Blues'.

9.title: Ooey, Ooey, Allergies!
9.plot: Captain Feathersword plays the musical memory game and then we all learn that some people have allergies through a song. There's numeracy with Wags the Dog, alphabet fun and a song about being safely 'buckled up' in the car.

10.title: A Lot of Camelot
10.plot: The Wiggles are putting on a play and use their director Gregory Griggs. Then it's fun with the alphabet and a dance party with 'Hot Potato', 'The Shimmie Shake' and 'Koala-By'.

11.title: Tasty Science
11.plot: Professor Simon teaches Captain Feathersword all about volume with a tasty glass of cranberry juice. Wags learns about numbers by counting bones. Anthony recites a poem about a bee and then has fun with the alphabet.

12.title: Toot Toot!
12.plot: The Wiggles dance with Wags the Dog while Emma has a riddle about goats and Simon plays 'Simon Says'. Captain Feathersword recites his pat-a-cake poem and Anthony has fun with the alphabet.

13.title: Invisible Lachy
13.plot: Lachy's inventions always result in fun. This time, he becomes invisible, but only for a short time. Anthony has fun with the alphabet while we sing and dance with Dorothy the Dinosaur and do the 'Romp Bomp a Stomp!'.

14.title: Yummy, Yummy!
14.plot: Dorothy the Dinosaur does some counting with oranges. Anthony and Simon sing about Michael Finnegan and then begin again. Dance to the 'Bunny Hop' and 'Hot Potato' while Lachy will engage you with his singing lesson.

15.title: Let's Go Driving in the Big Red Car!
15.plot: We'll see all of our friends as we drive through the countryside in the Big Red Car. Children will listen to the clues and guess the answer to the 'Who Am I?' segment. And Anthony has fun with the alphabet.

16.title: Excuse Meow!
16.plot: Poor Lachy the cat is not feeling very well. And so The Wiggles must find a way to make him better; music always helps. Anthony has fun with the alphabet and it's a musical feast when we say the dance and then do the dance.

17.title: Let's All Shake!
17.plot: The Wiggles make music with percussion and then sing about their friends in 'Everybody's Here'. Captain Feathersword recites a poem about Gregory Griggs and then we dance along like different animals in 'Come On Let's Jump'.

18.title: Beautiful Ballet
18.plot: Emma demonstrates some beautiful ballet for the children to join in. The Wiggles sing a song from the Pacific Islands and Anthony has fun with the alphabet while Lachy counts eggs.

19.title: Who Am I?
19.plot: Children will listen to the clues and play 'Who Am I?' Wags the Dog learns some musical science as he sees what will float in water. Meanwhile Anthony has fun with the alphabet.

20.title: A Hair Disaster!
20.plot: Lachy's inventions always result in fun, so when he creates something that can change hair styles it becomes a hair disaster. Can Madam Bouffant save the day? Meanwhile Anthony has some alphabet fun.

21.title: Pirate Poetry
21.plot: The Wiggles love singing and dancing so much that they can transform a couch into a musical instrument. There's just one problem; Lachy is trying to sleep on that couch. Captain Feathersword joins the fun with a pirate poem.

22.title: The Mango Walk
22.plot: Professor Simon gives Emma a fun science lesson using a glass of orange juice while Anthony and Dorothy the Dinosaur learn about the alphabet using an apple, but all that learning makes Anthony hungry.

23.title: Emma's Missing Bow
23.plot: Emma can't find her favorite bow. The Wiggles call the famous French detective Dr Simeon to help solve the mystery, and it turns out the answer might just be right under their noses.

24.title: We Like Fruit
24.plot: The Wiggles need to keep healthy and strong so that they can sing and dance with all their friends, and the best way to do that is to eat lots of healthy fruit and vegetables.

25.title: Is That Lachy?
25.plot: Emma has a brand new alarm clock to give to one of her friends. Have fun putting the clues together and try to guess who Emma's present is for. The rest of The Wiggles are busy learning new dance moves, singing 'I Stamp'.

26.title: Hula Hoop Symphony
26.plot: The Wiggles have so much fun playing with their hula hoops that they decide to form a hula hoop symphony. Spinning a hula hoop and singing at the same time makes Lachy pretty sleepy, so they need your help to wake him up.

27.title: Clean Your Teeth!
27.plot: Before The Wiggles leave for a big show they remember that they have to take care of their teeth. The Wiggles invite their friend Dennis the Dentist over to learn about brushing and taking care of their teeth.

28.title: Percussion Party
28.plot: There is always something fun to do at The Wiggles' house. Emma and Captain Feathersword are making up poems while playing dress-ups and trying on cowboy hats, and The Wiggles recite some of their favorite nursery rhymes.

29.title: Marty Party
29.plot: Today is a special day in Wiggle House because it is Anthony's birthday. The Wiggles are throwing a huge party to celebrate Anthony's special day, but they need help to make it the best birthday party ever.

30.title: Is It Captain Feathersword?
30.plot: Anthony has a crazy new dance which he wants to try out with one of his wiggly friends. Using Anthony's clues, have fun trying to work out who the mystery friend is.

31.title: Is That Wags?
31.plot: Captain Feathersword has cooked a treat for one of his friends, but he wants you to try and guess who. Use the clues and see if you can solve the mystery. Join The Wiggles as they sing a traditional Eskimo song.

32.title: Harry Hula
32.plot: The Wiggles love playing with hula hoops and seeing who can keep their hoop spinning the longest, but their friend Captain Feathersword doesn't know how to hula. Emma tries to teach Captain Feathersword how.

33.title: Musical Memory
33.plot: There are lots of musical activities to do in The Wiggles' house. Join Captain Feathersword and Professor Simon while they play with musical instruments and learn the different sounds that different instruments make.

34.title: Doctor Entertainment
34.plot: Emma, Lachy and Simon are taking turns reading to each other from their favourite storybook, but Lachy's reading is so boring that he soon puts everyone to sleep.

35.title: Singing With Lachy
35.plot: Lachy loves to sing, and he wants you to join in with him. From high notes to low notes, Lachy's singing lessons will help you sing better than you've ever sung before.

36.title: Quack, Quack!
36.plot: When The Wiggles find some old Broadway canes they decide to perform a Broadway style musical number in their own lounge room. With jazzy singing and tap dancing, it's like a musical trip back in time.

37.title: Slow Motion Anthony
37.plot: Disaster in Wiggle House as Anthony is magically reduced to doing everything in slow motion. If he stays in slow motion, he won't be able to keep up with The Wiggles and their friends having fun.

38.title: Lounge Room Symphony
38.plot: Do you want to make music but don't have any musical instruments to play with? Don't worry, The Wiggly Lounge Room Symphony will show you how you can use your hands, feet, voice and things around the house as instruments.

39.title: Wiggly Yoga
39.plot: The Wiggles are always trying new ways to keep healthy and strong, and today Anthony is trying out the ancient art of yoga. Unfortunately Anthony doesn't have much practice with yoga and becomes stuck in a pretzel shape.

40.title: A Musical Cake
40.plot: Master chef Murray the Cook has discovered a way to make cakes even more delicious by adding a secret ingredient - music. Murray the Cook goes to Wiggle House to join The Wiggles in baking the tastiest and most musical cake.

41.title: The Glass Is Half Full
41.plot: Professor Simon is back to teach The Wiggles about science and maths using everyday objects in Wiggle House. Today's lesson uses a glass of tasty milk to learn about volume, and whether the glass is full, half-full, or empty.

42.title: Simon Says
42.plot: Simon always love to play his favorite game, 'Simon Says'. While playing his favorite game with Lachy and Emma, Simon loses control and begins playing 'Simon Says' at super speed.

43.title: Sign the ABC!
43.plot: The Wiggles want everyone to be able to join in and have fun in Wiggle House, for the boys and girls who have trouble hearing or communicating in Australia there is Auslan, a special way of talking with hands and gestures.

44.title: Joannie Works with One Hammer
44.plot: You can have lots of fun using your imagination, like with the song 'Joannie Works With One Hammer' where you imagine that your hands, feet and your head are pretend hammers as you jump around and hammer away at the air.

45.title: Doctor Anglais
45.plot: During one of his many magical adventures, Anthony seems to have been transported back in time and now dresses and speaks like people did hundreds of years ago.

46.title: Is That Simon?
46.plot: Captain Feathersword has a brand new hula hoop to give to one of his friends in Wiggle House, but who is it for? Use the captain's clues to work out who in Wiggle house is getting a hula hoop.

47.title: Professor Simon's Musical Challenge
47.plot: The Wiggles are visited by a friend from Saudi Arabia, and learn how to sing 'Rock-a-Bye Your Bear' in Arabic. And Simon gives Dorothy the Dinosaur a singing lesson.

48.title: Captain's Experiment
48.plot: Captain Feathersword is learning about science from Professor Simon, who once again shows how the kitchen can become your very own science lab. Emma is teaching a lesson in ballet, a beautiful type of dancing.

49.title: Doctor Treble Clef
49.plot: Simon is one of the most talented singers in the Wiggly world, but his cowbell playing could use some improvement. The Wiggles decide to call the musical genius Doctor Treble Clef to see if he can help Simon.

50.title: Captain and the Tomatoes
50.plot: Captain Feather sword and Professor Simon are in The Wiggles' kitchen learning about numerals and addition using some delicious and healthy tomatoes.

51.title: What's That Sound?
51.plot: Join The Wiggles - Anthony, Emma, Lachy and Simon - on an exciting new adventure during this new series featuring over 70 songs, including Wiggle classics and new material.

52.title: A Juicy Story
52.plot: Professor Simon is back in the kitchen teaching his Wiggly friends about science and maths. His first lesson is with Lachy, showing how you can wiggle and learn even if you're just enjoying a glass of apple juice.

imdb.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
plot: Ready, Steady, Wiggle. is The Wiggles' 7th and 8th TV Series. They are the first TV series to feature the new Wiggles.
